      • getEvent

        public void getEvent(java.lang.String eventId)
        Takes the input eventId and queries for that event If empty-string as input, create a new parse object and create dialog to get the type Otherwise, get and record all of the event's attributes If the event is a cloned event, create a new parse object instead of using the old object
        Parameters:
        eventId - String containing the currently viewed event; if empty, then new event

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName(java.lang.String facebookId)
        Get the name for a given FacebookId or ParseId
        Parameters:
        facebookId - id matching the FacebookID column or the objectId in the User table
        Returns:
        returns the full name of the user

        Gets the ParseId for a given FacebookID
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • listInListList

        public java.lang.String listInListList(java.util.List<com.parse.ParseObject> ll,
                                       java.util.List<java.lang.String> l)
        Checks whether a list is contained in a list of lists For use to check if inviteList is already saved
        Parameters:
        ll - list of ParseObjects (Arrays) that contain a list of
        l - desired list to be checked with
        Returns:
        returns the objectId of the InviteList object if it exists; else returns empty string

      • saveOldInviteEvents

        public void saveOldInviteEvents()
        Looks for existing events and updates them Only updates things that can be changed by other users (e.g. RSVP is unchanged) Should only be called by the creator, since only creator can update anything

        Saves all attributes for the user's event
